Not bad, not bad. They look like they're moving very quickly though, judging from the shadow, the video only showed about an hour. Is it going to be possible to have things that swirl? But good demonstration of the concept.

I'm not entirely sure. I think it could be doable, right now I'm just using a couple textures I found in a Google search. I think what could be done is using a couple "rainbow" "cloud" textures, and a blending layer that would select the color to use to create some REALLY interesting patterns. Shaders are super powerful. I think it could be done. Just not 100% on it yet.

I made a very quick video too. I happened to have a ship returning to Kerbin so I took this while it was approaching. Sadly KAC paused it and thew up a popup right as it was getting interesting, but maybe it makes it a better teaser...

OOOH... I like it. Requires much less patience than my launch videos.

It is. Go to his link, click "download zip" on the right side, and in that zip find the gamedata folder. In that folder is a BoulderCo folder. Put THAT folder in your actual GameData folder and bammo. City lights.

The other problem I had with LKO was the cloud layer. It does look good from higher altitudes, but in LKO, it appears as though the clouds are sitting on the top of the atmosphere.

Edit: I think the issue is that the cloud layer seems to be moving very fast.
